newsitem.title: HONG KONG: RESEARCH ALERT - Great Eagle to outperform HSI.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Great Eagle to outperform HSI.

text.p: Lehman Brothers Asia Holdings Ltd said on Monday it had issued an "outperform" recommendation on Great Eagle Holdings.

Lehman said the property group was set to outperform the Hang Seng Index on growing contributions from its hotel operations, the recent resolution of key issues holding up a major redevelopment project in Hong Kong's Mongkok district and the likely spin-off of its office holdings.

The office spin-off was likely to take place after completion of the 1.8 million square foot Mongkok development, which is expected to generate a profit of HK$2.8 billion for Great Eagle, Lehman said.
Great Eagle engages in property development and investment in Hong Kong and has worldwide property operations.

Lehman's property analysts Michael Leary and Patrick Chau said the company's prospects have been greatly enhanced by two hotel acquisitions -- one in Melbourne and the other in Toronto -- as well as the upturn in Hong Kong's grade A office rents.
Lehman said Great Eagle's net asset value was revised to HK$45 to reflect its enhanced capital value. It gave no comparative figure.
Earnings per share estimates have been revised to HK$2.15 for fiscal 1996 and HK$2.45 for fiscal 1997, it said.
